Bernd wrote:

>	How do you run "all tests"? Is this a feature with dependent projects?

See below. No, with all projects.

>	What I use mostly to run tests is: In the "Package Explorer" view
>	select a test class (or a package) and then choose Run/Run as.../Junit
test
>	and it runs the single test class or all test classes found in the
selected
>	package.

I use Package Explorer two, but not sure it matters. Select your "java
project" just to be safe. Then go to "Run/Run...". Select a JUnit test, new,
and then (with your project name it up top) check "All tests in Project,
Source Folder or Package". Knowing Eclipse, I am sure there are other ways
also. :-)

regards

Adam
